title: Avon Valley Path Walking Route

images.title: Dave Bevis / Bickton - View towards Fordingbridge, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bickton - View towards Fordingbridge. The River Avon is in the foreground. The tower of St Mary's Church, Fordingbridge, can be seen in the middle distance.

images.title: (Wellington) [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Avon and bridge at Fordingbridge. The bridge is 40 metres long and consists of seven stone arches. As such it is one of just two bridges with seven arches in the UK. It dates from the medieval period.

images.title: Clive Perrin / Ibsley bridge River Avon Hampshire, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ibsley bridge over the River Avon. Rebuilt from the foundations with two additional spans, by the County Council in 1930.

images.title: Trish Steel [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Avon near Ibsley. The river rises in the Vale of Pewsey and flows through Wiltshire, Hampshire and Dorset to the sea at Christchurch. The river and its tributaries form one of the most diverse chalk stream systems in England.

images.title: Peter Facey / Spinnaker Sailing Club on Blashford Lake
images.caption: Spinnaker Sailing Club on Blashford Lake

images.title: Chris Talbot / Christchurch - Harbour
images.caption: Christchurch Harbour at the end of the route

description: This wonderful river valley footpath takes you from Salisbury to Christchurch on the South Coast. You start by the magnificent cathedral in Salisbury and head south towards Downton. The path then continues through Woodgreen and Godshill Wood before you arrive at the lovely Hampshire town of Fordingbridge . The next section is a particularly pleasant waterside path taking you along the River Avon to Ibsley where the path passes through the Blashford Lakes which has a variety of wildlife to enjoy. The final section then follows the river into Christchurch where you finish at Christchurch Harbour and Priory .
